page.title: 13OLD PEOPLE 1.
page.content: A large number of{old people}told us how they used to work in the{weaving {sheds.}One woman said that her friend lost an eye through a shuttle flying off the loom.Many of the{men fought} in the{First World War}and one man fought on horseback.The average wage of a mill worker was 12 shillings.Most {children}started{school}at the age of five and finished at eleven.They then went on to{work}at the{mills.}The most popular games were cricket and football.A large number of children had bikes.It was two pence on the trams.Little fishes and toffee babies were popular{sweets.}Working hours were from 6 o'clock until 5.30.Most people went to{Blackpool}for their {holidays.}It was{1 shilling}for the week on the{pier.}The girls games were skipping and "hot ollen".Most people enjoyed school.
